creator: noah@rave.ca
text:
[Sun Feb 11 07:00:02 2007] [crit] [Sun Feb 11 07:00:02 2007] file
.\\server\\mpm\\winnt\\child.c, line 1120, assertion "(rv >= 0) && (rv <
threads_created)" failed

I keep having this error message in the error.log and whenever it happens apache
will crash (keep running) and not server any more pages... It happens about once
a day... If not more... And I have to manually restart.

I can't figure out how to reproduce the problem but it seems to be from a build
up of something...

I hope someone can figure it out.

Created attachment 19572
Error.log file

If you look closely to the resets every hour, you will see the child processes
go down from 250...

[Sat Feb 10 03:00:02 2007] [notice] Child 7504: Waiting for 179 worker threads
to exit.
[Sat Feb 10 04:00:02 2007] [notice] Child 3656: Waiting for 172 worker threads
to exit.
[Sat Feb 10 05:00:02 2007] [notice] Child 6484: Waiting for 169 worker threads
to exit.
[Sat Feb 10 06:00:02 2007] [notice] Child 7636: Waiting for 167 worker threads
to exit.
[Sat Feb 10 06:00:02 2007] [crit] [Sat Feb 10 06:00:02 2007] file
.\\server\\mpm\\winnt\\child.c, line 1120, assertion "(rv >= 0) && (rv <
threads_created)" failed
[Sat Feb 10 07:00:02 2007] [notice] Child 6272: Waiting for 162 worker threads
to exit.
[Sat Feb 10 07:00:02 2007] [crit] [Sat Feb 10 07:00:02 2007] file
.\\server\\mpm\\winnt\\child.c, line 1120, assertion "(rv >= 0) && (rv <
threads_created)" failed
[Sat Feb 10 08:00:02 2007] [notice] Child 5128: Waiting for 158 worker threads
to exit.
[Sat Feb 10 08:00:02 2007] [crit] [Sat Feb 10 08:00:02 2007] file
.\\server\\mpm\\winnt\\child.c, line 1120, assertion "(rv >= 0) && (rv <
threads_created)" failed

until there are 0 left and then apache stops serving pages all together...
creator: noah@rave.ca
rpluem@apache.org
text:
Seems to be a known and debated issue. See the following links for reference

http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/200608.mbox/%3c44D0F1AC.5090703@rowe-clan.net%3e
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/200608.mbox/%3c44D0FA5C.40704@apache.org%3e
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/200608.mbox/%3c44D0F1AC.5090703@rowe-clan.net%3e
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=428008
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=488780

So, is there any workaround for this? I mean binary or something...

The most annoying thing is that httpd process grows from 30Mb up to 200Mb after 
that, stops destroying threads even if I have these settings in config:

<IfModule mpm_winnt.c>
ThreadsPerChild 300
MaxRequestsPerChild  1
</IfModule>

EnableMMAP off
EnableSendfile off
Win32DisableAcceptEx

Another annoying thing is that it starts to wait too much before starting to 
transfer any file (image, css) after such sort of crash in cases if I have 
MaxRequestsPerChild other than 1.

Thank you.
creator: a.alfimov@gmail.com
rpluem@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 11997 ***
